Working Well by Light + Fit App

Privacy Policy

This Privacy Policy describes how Working Well (“we”, “our” or “us”) discloses information, and what choices you have with respect to the information in connection with your use of www.lightandfit.com (the “Site”) and the associated Working Well app, features and content (the “Services”).

What Does This Privacy Policy Cover?

This Privacy Policy covers the treatment of personally identifiable information gathered when you are using or accessing the Services. This Privacy Policy does not apply to the practices of third parties that we do not own or control, including but not limited to any third party websites, services and applications that you elect to access through Slack or to individuals that we do not manage or employ. While we attempt to facilitate access only to those Third Party Services that share our respect for your privacy, we cannot take responsibility for the content or privacy policies of those Third Party Services. We encourage you to carefully review the privacy policies of any Third Party Services you access.

What Information Do We Collect?

Working Well is simply here to help you incorporate wellness practices into your workday. We'll receive the authentication token, the user name, and the workspace channel from Slack and store that in our database. Besides that, we won't have access to any other data (or any sensitive data). This information is the only information we need to make the service available to you. This information shall not be used for any external purposes, it will only be used to make the service available to you and to track the amount of app downloads. Webhook URLs and download counts collected will only be accessible by the brand, agency partner, and developers . We do not collect any other personal information about you from Slack.

Furthermore, all other data resulting from your use of Slack is not visible to us, such as all your messages in your chats and channels.

Third party providers:

Working Well does not display advertising and does not pass on any data to advertisers or other providers with commercial interests. No data will be passed on to third parties for any other purpose than the functional provision of the service itself. For the functional provision of the service we work together with the developer Working Well to build and maintain the app. The developer does not collect any data, just ensures the app functions properly.

Email, Text, and Push:

Notification Communications: We may communicate with you via push notification, to the extent you permit us to do so.

Aggregate:

Information: We collect statistical information about how many users download the app. This statistical information is not Personal Information and cannot be tied back to you, your Account or your web browser.

How Can I Delete The App?

Should you ever decide to stop using the Working Well app, you may do so through Slack, by withdrawing from the Slack channel housing the app or by deleting the app plugin.

Update of the data protection information

If necessary due to legal changes or as soon as changes in the data processing carried out by us make this necessary, we will adapt these instructions. Therefore Light + Fit asks you to inform yourself regularly about the content. As soon as the changes make it necessary for you to cooperate (e.g. consent) or any other individual notification, we will of course inform you immediately.

California Privacy Rights?

This section provides additional details about the personal information we collect about California consumers and the rights afforded to them under the California Consumer Privacy Act or “CCPA.”

For more details about the personal information we have collected over the last 12 months, please see the What Information Do We Collect? section above. We collect this information for the business and commercial purposes described in the What Information Do We Collect? section above. We do not sell (as such term is defined in the CCPA) the personal information we collect (and will not sell it without providing a right to opt out). Please note that we do use third-party cookies for our advertising purposes as further described in our Cookie Policy.

Subject to certain limitations, the CCPA provides California consumers the right to request to know more details about the categories or specific pieces of personal information we collect (including how we use and disclose this information), to delete their personal information, to opt out of any “sales” that may be occurring, and to not be discriminated against for exercising these rights.

California consumers may make a request pursuant to their rights under the CCPA by contacting us at workingwellapp@gmail.com. We will verify your request using the information associated with your account, including email address. Government identification may be required. Consumers can also designate an authorized agent to exercise these rights on their behalf.

What If I Have Questions or Concerns?

If you have any questions or concerns regarding privacy using the Working Well app, please send us a detailed message to workingwellapp@gmail.com. We will make every effort to resolve your concerns.

Effective Date: May 7th 2020
